fields.summary: Streamer threads may leak if failure happens when closing the striped outputstream

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: In HDFS-9794, it has solved problem of that stream thread leak if failure happens when closing the striped outputstream. And in {{DFSOutputStream}}, it also exists the same problem in {{DFSOutputStream#closeImpl}}. If failures happen when flushing data blocks, the streamer threads will also not be closed.
fields.summary: Streamer threads leak if failure happens when closing DFSOutputStream

This message was automatically generated.

All the test are passed, the fix looks fine to the current code. I did a code review to find similar issues in {{DfsOutputStream}}. The flushing data method {{DfsOutputStream#flushInternal}} is only used in {{DfsOutputStream#closeImpl}}, it seems that the case of this is the only place that will lead to streamer thread leak.
Update the latest patch. There are many places doesn't judging {{LOG.isDebugEnabled()}} when logging debug info in {{DFSOutputStream}} and {{DataStreamer}}. The latest patch fix this issues.
